DOC.brief_summary: 1 . To determine low nasal cannula flow rate upper airway deadspace reduce . Hypothesis - The low flow rate high flow nasal cannula ( HFNC ) reduce upper airway ( extrathoracic ) deadspace improve respiratory efficiency reduce transcutaneous CO2 and/or low respiratory rate . 2 . To determine low nasal cannula flow rate regional distribution ( define EIT ) ventilation change . Hypothesis - Moderate high flow rate create positive pressure lead improved regional distribution ventilation .
DOC.brief_title: Effects High Flow Nasal Cannula Deadspace Reduction Regional Distribution Ventilation
DOC.detailed_description: Background Significance Historically , oxygen nasal cannulae use hypoxemic patient therapy increase arterial oxygenation . In neonatal community , oxygen flow > 2 L/min > 4 L/min pediatric patient seldom use due potential excessive drying nasal mucosa risk develop hypothermia . It speculate large pediatric adult patient able good tolerate flow rate excess 4 L/min large nasal mucosal surface area support hydration dry medical grade gas . High flow nasal cannula ( HFNC ) therapy form respiratory support provide flow believe excess patient 's spontaneous inspiratory expiratory flow rate . These device intend provide optimal heat humidification medical gas regardless flow set . In case neonate , predominant patient population receive HFNC , clearly consensus flow constitute `` high '' population . If `` high '' intend mean flow rate exceeds spontaneous inspiratory flow rate reasonable clinical measurement ascertain relationship . Thus , true definition HFNC remain elusive term protocol hop shed light subject . Adverse Event Criteria Reporting Procedures Due fact pilot study PI review major adverse event . The following complication monitor major complication report IRB . Minor event include : bradycardia ( 10 % baseline ) , increase respiratory rate > 20 % , increase TCpCO2 10 mmHg , increase FIO2 > 0.3 , hypoventilation ( breath hold longer 15 second ) desaturation ( < 88 % ) . Major event halt study immediately report IRB : - Desaturation < 80 % ( continuously monitor pulse oximetry ) long 1 minute . - Bradycardia < 60 BPM All major minor event monitor report PI clinical research coordinator .
